Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 02:04PM annafrederik wrote: From what my onc has told me, if you have any kind of edema, it settles in the neck while you're horizontal. I sleep much better with my head elevated or sleeping in a recliner.

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2011 10:35PM annafrederik wrote: Well, turns out I've had ONJ for years, discovered on a bone scan three years ago. Nice of the onc to let me know. Had the extraction as dentist didn't think I had anything to lose at this point. I really don't understand why I had to find this out by accident. I would have thought an oncologist would have told me something like that. He actually got kind of pissy with me when I asked why I wasn't informed. How did you make out Cynthia?

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2011 07:48PM annafrederik wrote: Ladies, thank you so much for the responses. You are all very kind and informative. When you look at it that way, I guess, what have you got to lose, if it could happen regardless of dental work. Gawd, it never ends. I really really hate cancer. Good luck to you as well, Cynthia!

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2011 10:20AM annafrederik wrote: Not to scare you, because I'm sure it can be caused by a hundred different things, but that's how my liver mets were found. I had a weird taste in my mouth, like my saliva was bitter. When I ate or drank something, it didn't taste right, especially when it hit the taste buds on the side of my tongue. All the oncs thought I was nuts until an onc nurse friend of mine told me it can sometimes be a symptom of liver or GI mets.
Posts.Title: Terrible taste? dianaleo ejnova
